sentence.text: His face was so tense as he held her and gazed deep into her eyes .
With a hesitant smile she turned away from him , and sipped what was left of her champagne and gazed out of the window .
Robyn gazed across at Anne .
Ruth gazed about her in awe .
He stopped for a moment and gazed about him .
Cecil gazed about the office as if in search of inspiration .
He gazed despairingly about the room .
Most of them went through the ritual of gazing about them with curious eyes in search of a familiar face among the crowds .
In silence , Victoria Hamilton gazed across her children 's heads , thinking about their future .
They stood up and gazed across the garden .
I nodded and gazed adoringly across the table at those dark , passionate eyes .
Joan gazed at him with disgust , but then began to smile .
She appeared to be gazing straight at Liz without seeing her .
All trainees gazed admiringly at the man who was paid to teach them .
Settling himself in one of the big , shabby armchairs , Tug gazed suspiciously at the television screen and waited for a picture to appear .
Irina gazed from Alexei to Jehana , and then back again .
Claudia gazed from the window .
For a long time he gazed into the depths of the rice , muttering .
And , as he smiled , he was gazing into the eyes of an extraordinarily beautiful dark-haired girl .
Perhaps imagine yourself in a cosy armchair , gazing into a log fire , stroking the cat on your lap and sipping a glass of dandelion wine .
His eyes gaze steadfastly into yours as you talk .
A fever grew inside him as he gazed on her .
Two liquid brown eyes gazed on them with mild curiosity , rising and falling with the pull of the waves .
` So am I. " Heather turned again to the opening and gazed hard over the fields to where the spirals of smoke were rising behind the bushes .
Rory pushed herself out of her chair , suddenly fuelled by restless energy , and strode to the window , gazing unseeingly over the lawn for a few moments as anger seethed within her .
The trooper gazed past Jotan at Arkhina and Jehana .
The fellow gazed suspiciously round the crowded tavern .
I rest my head against the bars and gaze through them as into a cage .
I would gaze towards home .
She gazed unseeingly out of the bus window .
Ricky gazed out of the window at stars as sleepless as himself .
Julie Murchison stood on the platform of Berkeley railway station and gazed around .
The animals gazed around cautiously .
Lifting her head , she gazed around bleakly , and sighed .
He gazed around him at the late afternoon sky .
Juliet , only half listening , gazed around the room .
Large , solemn grey eyes gazed back , shadowed with tension .
She blushed faintly and gazed back .
Agatha gazed coolly back .
She had no idea what Roman 's sister was thinking as she gazed steadily back .
She gazed out , but saw nothing .
I gazed out wildly over the crowds .
He paused again and gazed over my shoulder and I wondered what was coming next .
He leaned back in his chair , gazing over my shoulder at a picture on the wall .
Slowly raising his head , he gazed over the shattered , bemused figure in his arms , to give Carole a beaming smile .
A darkly florid officer with black moustache walked briskly through the debris , gazing round as though looking for someone .
The child gazed up , fascinated by the beauty so slender and warm and bright above her .
Cedric sank happily on to the tattered hearthrug at his feet and gazed up adoringly at his new master .
She was right below her window now , gazing up those steep granite walls .
I gazed down at the reclining form .
The beauty had disappeared below deck now and Fernando was leaning on the handrail waiting for her and gazing out towards the harbour buildings .
On each landing , opposite the lift-shaft , the poster with the enormous face gazed from the wall .
